basis: User repeatedly expresses actionable intent (two-week trial, logging most days, adaptable plan, accountability). Positive, collaborative tone and explicit readiness to start and adjust indicate a high likelihood they will implement the plan closely.
cognitive_dissonance: Slight tension between wanting a light, non-micromanaged approach and the desire for structured logging. Likely to negotiate balance by preferring a lighter daily log on non-craving days and optional soft pauses.
negative_thought_patterns: Might slip into all-or-nothing thinking or over-justification (e.g., 'if I miss logging, I failed'), but tempered by emphasis on flexibility and adjustments.
emotional_triggers: Commitment pressure, concern about feeling micromanaged, frustration with cravings, heat discomfort in Suwon, and the variability of BED cravings which can provoke worry about consistency.
coaching_notes: Maintain simplicity and flexibility. Encourage a light daily log on no-craving days plus a brief end-of-day reflection. Support soft pause/override options for high-stress days. Use accountability checks and weekly pattern summaries to guide adjustments and maintain motivation.
